findings.title: FSA - Fixed Swap Address
findings.description: The swap address is assigned once in the constructor and it cannot be changed. This may prevent the contract from catching up with future swap updates.

findings.title: Code Repetition
findings.description: There are code segments that are repetitive in the contract. Those segments increase the code size of the contract unnecessarily.

findings.title: Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.
findings.function: decreaseAllowance, increaseAllowance, transferFrom, transfer, totalSupply, decimals, symbol, name, transferOwnership

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Detected missing events for critical arithmetic parameters. There are functions that have no event emitted, so it is difficult to track off-chain changes.

findings.title: ST - Stop Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop transactions for all users excluding the owner by setting the `maxTx` to zero.

findings.title: Exceed Limit Fees Manipulation
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase the transfer fees over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `setTransferTax` function with a high percentage value.
